title: Inalienability

articles.content: When we say that we hold individual rights to be inalienable, we must mean just that. Inalienable means that which we may not take away, suspend, infringe, restrict or violate—not ever, not at any time, not for any purpose whatsoever.
articles.attribution:
“Textbook of Americanism,”
The Ayn Rand Column, 92
